questions.question: When reversing, you should?

options.C: Turn around and look through the rear window

questions.explanation: Option A, 'Check both side mirrors,' provides limited visibility and is insufficient for a comprehensive view of the rear. Option B, 'Check all rearview mirrors,' is better than A but still leaves blind spots. Option C, 'Turn around and look through the rear window,' offers the clearest rear view and is the correct method. Option D, 'Look at the rearview mirror,' is too limited and can overlook obstacles.

questions.question: When parking on an uphill behind a large vehicle, why should you leave more space?

options.C: You can bypass it when it starts slowly
options.D: Large vehicles may roll back when starting, hitting your car

questions.explanation: Option A, 'You can be seen by the vehicle in front,' is not directly related to safety. Option B, 'You won’t inhale the truck's exhaust,' is beneficial to health but unrelated to safety. Option C, 'You can bypass it when it starts slowly,' is dangerous, especially if the vehicle rolls back. Option D, 'Large vehicles may roll back when starting, hitting your car,' explains the correct reason.
questions.meta_keywords: Vancouver driver's license test, BC driver's license test uphill parking, parking, large vehicles, roll back, space

questions.question: If a vehicle is tailgating you too closely, the best way to protect yourself is?

options.A: Increase the space in front of your car
options.B: Increase the space behind your car
options.C: Honk and flash your brake lights
options.D: Brake sharply and drive away quickly

questions.explanation: Option A, 'Increase the space in front of your car,' reduces the likelihood of needing to brake suddenly, minimizing the risk of an accident. Option B, 'Increase the space behind your car,' is nearly impossible when a car is tailgating. Option C, 'Honk and flash your brake lights,' may alarm or provoke the tailgating driver. Option D, 'Brake sharply and drive away quickly,' significantly increases the risk of a rear-end collision.
questions.meta_keywords: Vancouver driver's license test, BC driver's license test tailgating, increase space, safe distance, avoid accidents
